page.title: 15CROPS GROWN IN KENT
page.content: Bockingfold farm has 171 acres of cereals. Under this category comes wheat and barley. When we were looking at the barley we noticed the outside was lighter than the inside of the field. This was because they had sprayed the outer edge to protect the barley from a disease called septoria (like mildew). They didn't spray the middle because they didn't want tracks going through the barley. They used a machine with an arm which extended 40 feet from the edge of the field. The winter wheat is used for making bread. The longbow variety is used as animal feed. The spring barley is used for making whisky and beer. Rape is also grown. Many Kent farms have started growing it in the last 2 years because it is more profitable at the moment than hops. It is used to make cooking oil and margarine.
